intro: Hypolytrum latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf hypolytrum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. Hypolytrum latifolium is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
